reviews.text: The city centre of Chongqing city. You can walk from metro station at the end the line and have hours on the street to reach the next station to go back. Plenty of shopping streets to see and go through. And don't forget to try pedestrian foods too. Cheap and cheerful.

City centre of Chongqing showing its economic power. Near you can find Night market street food. Take a slow walk and try Chongqing local foods and desserts. Dishes are spicy and numbing. Whereas desserts are too sweet. Take this into account before ordering food. You can ask beforehand food without spice or to add less spice
Lots of nice shopping malls.
Central of Chongqing City. It's a good place and you can eat bafei (all you can eat).
Mainly branded goods. Don't miss the "Street food" part.
The Great Hall of the People (人民大會堂) is a state building used for legislative and ceremonial activities by the government of the People's Republic of China.
Saw winne the pooh,  I wonder where eor is?
Somehow Xi Jinping looks like Winnie the pooh lol
Winnie the Pooh just chilling here
Don’t take your anger out on Liu Xia’s family (The widow of Chinese Nobel prize winner, Liu Xiaobo, who died in Chinese prison because he tried to make China a better place - which it can be....)

Wonderful museum with much more than the history of the three gorge project. Well curated but given importance of the history and culture more multilingual signs on exhibits and translation of textual material would be welcome. All that said time ran away from us and we left without seeing everything it has to offer

If you cannot go to the real Three Gorges Dam, then you can always visit this site. Amazing feat of engineering to see it. Can be reached by chongqing metro but you must walk a further distance to the museum. It's located opposite people's park building. One of the crowded place during weekends and public holidays. Make sure to come earlier to see it in details.
Can visit if in the area, free entry. Some history about three gorges. Catch the free cinematic show on the ground floor.
The most incredible engineering feat in human history!
Had a great fun time with the kids.
安岳三大之一，卧佛院不算

A small prison camp located on a mountainside. You can walk about 30 minutes from the Ciqikou station. There is no entry fee.

The camp itself is pretty small, maybe it takes you 15 minutes to walk through. You can walk into the holding cells and see some torture devices that were used. 

Unfortunately there is very little English so most of the exhibits leave no impression on me.
值得來，但人潮太多
免费景点，锻炼身体好去处
洗腦的地方_3

The Stilwell Museum is a museum in Yuzhong District of Chongqing, China, which preserves the former residence of General Joseph W. Stilwell, the Allied Chief of Staff in the China Theater during World War II. It opened in 1994.
World War 2 history frozen in time.
A very neat museum. Recommended to those who are interested in WW2 history.
Needs a little tender love here and there otherwise kids enjoy it

I struggle to see how some people can still recommend this place. It is a total dump. Hopefully one day this town council will wake up and do something about it. Even the area around the Spa is filthy and fast becoming like a ghost town.
Good place for sport, vacation and work meetings
Fascinating history, well renovated and conserved sculptures.
Be prepared to spend plenty of time wandering these beautiful carvings and understanding the history behind them.
Dazu rock carvings, Baoding Buddhas, dating from the 9th to 13th century.China.

We have came here from Chonqging. First bus for 45CNY to Dazu and then bus 205 to Rock Carvings. Entrance fee is pretty high 135 CNY/pp. This place sometimes might be crowded with chinese groups. But rock carvings are amazing. Dont miss to visit museum and temple complex in the surrounding area.
Stunning rock carvings; truly a world heritage.

I don't think it is worth it, all of the demon statues are actually plastic.

The temple are nice and the atmosphere is good, but it is too far from the center of chongqing to be worth a visit.

It was a fairly uninteresting place to go. I had incorrectly thought it was a city that had been deserted due to the building of the 3 Gorges Dam. Instead it was a place to celebrate the Chinese underworld / afterlife. Our guide was friendly and could speak English but there are far more interesting cultural and historical sites to see in China. So unless you are on a Yongtze river cruise I would not bother with seeing this place.
The only place in China where there's a temple for Hades. A good place to visit to learn about ancient Chinese legends. Comes free as well if you're on the cruise
Loads of stairs but take the cable car if you have dodgy knees

Great place - our guide was informative and gave us great insight into the culture and history of this place
Take the Gondola@
Surreal. What a beautiful place.. but slightly 'messed up' by the Transformer in the middle of it all! Should have kept in natural.
Great to see!
Amazing! One of the highlights of my many travels.
Wonderful place.
....Seem like.. Lost in ancient times... 🌸🌸🌸
